title: Waistcoat, ca. 1790
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery, silk foundation, linen back
Technique: embroidered in satin, stem and knot stitches on plain weave foundation
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Gentleman's embroidered waistcoat with standing collar, straight hem, pocket welts and covered buttons. Embroidered in polychrome silks in more than twenty colors. Over-all spot pattern of flowers and insects, grasshoppers, caterpillars and insects at lower edge.

tombstone.epitaph:
Waistcoat, ca. 1790.
ca. 1790. Medium: silk embroidery, silk foundation, linen back
Technique: embroidered in satin, stem and knot stitches on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-54-43.
